aria-label.description: Defines a string value that labels the current element.

aria-labelledby.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that labels the current element.

aria-describedby.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that describes the object.

aria-details.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that provide a detailed, extended description for the object.

getDropOperation.description:
A function returning the drop operation to be performed when items matching the given types are dropped
on the drop target.

onDrop.description: Handler that is called when a valid drag is dropped on the drop target.

onDropActivate.description:
Handler that is called after a valid drag is held over the drop target for a period of time.
This typically opens the item so that the user can drop within it.

onDropEnter.description: Handler that is called when a valid drag enters the drop target.

onDropExit.description: Handler that is called when a valid drag exits the drop target.

onDropMove.description: Handler that is called when a valid drag is moved within the drop target.

onHoverChange.description: Handler that is called when the hover state changes.

onHoverEnd.description: Handler that is called when a hover interaction ends.

onHoverStart.description: Handler that is called when a hover interaction starts.

slot.description:
A slot name for the component. Slots allow the component to receive props from a parent component.
An explicit `null` value indicates that the local props completely override all props received from a parent.

isDisabled.description: Whether the drop target is disabled. If true, the drop target will not accept any drops.

children.description: The children of the component. A function may be provided to alter the children based on component state.

className.description: The CSS [className](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/className) for the element. A function may be provided to compute the class based on component state.

style.description: The inline [style](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/style) for the element. A function may be provided to compute the style based on component state.
